name: Gaurav Srivastava
position: Chief Sales Officer at Manipal Fintech- Gold Loans
about: As the Chief Sales Officer at Manipal Fintech , I lead the sales organization to drive sustainable growth in the Gold loans , Credit cards , Revenue based financing , Personal Loans , Consumer Durables , BFSI segment. With over 20 years of experience in sales and marketing, I have a proven track record of building high-performance teams, launching new channels, and optimizing existing ones for maximum efficiency and customer satisfaction. I was also a co-founder of Elements of Decor, a startup in the home decor industry targeting the mass affluent segment. I launched the brand on an eCommerce marketplace, overseeing product selection, quality checks, and customer satisfaction. Additionally, I developed strategic partnerships with suppliers to ensure a diverse product range and competitive pricing. My expertise in business leadership, new business development, and business strategy has enabled me to achieve remarkable results in various sectors, including B2B, eCommerce, and online companies.

name: Allan Fernandes
position: IIM B | Ex PwC | Building the future of FinTech
about: At Manipal FinTech, I've had the chance to apply modern technology to solve tangible business problems. We've launched 0-to-1 platforms from scratch, built an agent network that now drives over ‚Çπ15 Cr a month, and reimagined everything from onboarding to reconciliation. Presently I am leading the development of a commercial lending product with an AI underwriting model that has slashed approval times from weeks to days. This hands-on experience has fueled a deeper fascination with AI's potential. I am now deeply exploring the next frontier of this technology, experimenting with a suite of AI tools that can be used to build truly intelligent, adaptive financial systems. My journey to this point was built on a foundation of large-scale transformation. At Genpact and TCS, I led multi-million dollar programs for PwC UK's portfolio, reworked enterprise architectures, and boosted productivity that took invoice auto-posting from 10% to 60%. Beyond Work This forward-looking curiosity is balanced by a deep appreciation for the past. I'm an history and geopolitics enthusiast, fascinated by how global events shape the very institutions we build products for today. This also manifests in a more tangible form: I'm a numismatist, collecting stories of empires and trade, one coin at a time. As a curious traveler, I've explored over 20 countries, soaking in cultures and perspectives that constantly challenge my own. Whether it's a complex system, a historical event, or a new city, I'm always looking for the underlying patterns and the story waiting to be told. Let's connect.

Key deliverablesLaunched a multi system Agent Lead generation Channel from scratch - scaled to 200+ field advisors within 3 months, generating over ‚Çπ15Cr ($2M+) in monthly disbursals.‚Ä¢ Built Doorstep Banking integration with a leading private bank - added ‚Çπ2Cr/month in new loan volumes; resolved a systemic penalty logic bug, preserving compliance and trust.‚Ä¢ Digitized onboarding through automated ID creation, KYC APIs, and workflow validation - reduced TAT from 2 hours to 45 mins, with 80% fewer errors.‚Ä¢ Re-architected disbursal and reconciliation engines for the in-house NBFC - cut daily ops from 6 hours to 2 hours (automation pipeline targeting 30 mins).‚Ä¢ Redesigned onboarding and disbursal flows, identifying key opportunities for AI-driven automation with the potential to reduce TAT by up to 70%‚Ä¢ Proposed a scalable redesign of the database schema - enabled cross-platform traceability, reduced latency, and simplified change management.‚Ä¢ Established agile product operations: implemented structured PRD workflows, built a centralized design system, and evangelized tools like Figma, Miro, and Notion.‚Ä¢ Built and managed a 7-member cross-functional team (PMs & Designers) - embedded sprint rituals, backlog hygiene, and GTM cadence with business and tech.
positions.title: Head of Product
positions.description_html:
Currently leading the product charter at Manipal FinTech (formerly Sahi Bandhu), where I’ve built 0-to-1 digital platforms, scaled agent ecosystems, and redesigned mission-critical systems for onboarding, disbursal, and reconciliation. Key deliverables

Launched a multi system Agent Lead generation Channel from scratch - scaled to 200+ field advisors within 3 months, generating over ₹15Cr ($2M+) in monthly disbursals.
• Built Doorstep Banking integration with a leading private bank - added ₹2Cr/month in new loan volumes; resolved a systemic penalty logic bug, preserving compliance and trust.
• Digitized onboarding through automated ID creation, KYC APIs, and workflow validation - reduced TAT from 2 hours to 45 mins, with 80% fewer errors.
• Re-architected disbursal and reconciliation engines for the in-house NBFC - cut daily ops from 6 hours to 2 hours (automation pipeline targeting 30 mins).
• Redesigned onboarding and disbursal flows, identifying key opportunities for AI-driven automation with the potential to reduce TAT by up to 70%
• Proposed a scalable redesign of the database schema - enabled cross-platform traceability, reduced latency, and simplified change management.
• Established agile product operations: implemented structured PRD workflows, built a centralized design system, and evangelized tools like Figma, Miro, and Notion.
• Built and managed a 7-member cross-functional team (PMs & Designers) - embedded sprint rituals, backlog hygiene, and GTM cadence with business and tech.

experience.title: UK IT Test Manager
experience.description: Deputed to PwC UK on the staff augmentation model (as a contractor) through TCS. Following were my responsibilities as PwC staff:‚Ä¢ Participate in creation of business cases for projects, engagement proposals for vendors, reviewing bids by vendors and vendor selection. ‚Ä¢ Review and/or manage the testing by implementing the goals and testing processes established by PwC.‚Ä¢ Organize and lead risk identification and risk analysis sessions and use the results of such sessions to review/for test estimation, planning, monitoring and control.‚Ä¢ Review, create and/or implement test plans consistent with organizational policies and test strategies.‚Ä¢ Continuously monitor and control the test activities to achieve project objectives.‚Ä¢ Assess and report relevant and timely test status to all stakeholders.‚Ä¢ Identify skills and resource gaps in test teams and participate in sourcing adequate resources.‚Ä¢ Propose a business case for test activities & tools which outlines the costs and benefits expected.‚Ä¢ Ensure proper communication within the test team and with other project stakeholders.‚Ä¢ Participate in and lead test process improvement initiatives.Managed multiple vendors and ensured zero defect delivery on 20+ PwC UK IT projects, with a net value ~ GBP 80M across the tax, assurance, consulting and IFS lines of serviceConducted sessions for risk identification, risk analysis, and mitigation strategiesValidated and signed off on vendor test strategiesInfluenced and suggested vital implementation plan changes leading to 40% cost reduction of the projectReduced 80% defects on the MicroStrategy programDeveloped an Agile (Scrum) test strategy for the programBuilt a dedicated 5-member BAT (Business Analyst and Testing) team by cross-training professionals
experience.description_html:
Deputed to PwC UK on the staff augmentation model (as a contractor) through TCS. Following were my responsibilities as PwC staff:

• Participate in creation of business cases for projects, engagement proposals for vendors, reviewing bids by vendors and vendor selection.
• Review and/or manage the testing by implementing the goals and testing processes established by PwC.
• Organize and lead risk identification and risk analysis sessions and use the results of such sessions to review/for test estimation, planning, monitoring and control.
• Review, create and/or implement test plans consistent with organizational policies and test strategies.
• Continuously monitor and control the test activities to achieve project objectives.
• Assess and report relevant and timely test status to all stakeholders.
• Identify skills and resource gaps in test teams and participate in sourcing adequate resources.
• Propose a business case for test activities & tools which outlines the costs and benefits expected.
• Ensure proper communication within the test team and with other project stakeholders.
• Participate in and lead test process improvement initiatives.

Managed multiple vendors and ensured zero defect delivery on 20+ PwC UK IT projects, with a net value ~ GBP 80M across the tax, assurance, consulting and IFS lines of service
Conducted sessions for risk identification, risk analysis, and mitigation strategies
Validated and signed off on vendor test strategies
Influenced and suggested vital implementation plan changes leading to 40% cost reduction of the project
Reduced 80% defects on the MicroStrategy program
Developed an Agile (Scrum) test strategy for the program
Built a dedicated 5-member BAT (Business Analyst and Testing) team by cross-training professionals

about: Hey, Thanks for visiting my profile. I have had quite a wonderful corporate journey so far with my range of experience varying from manufacturing industries(Building Materials, Consumer durables) to the Service industry (Financial Services) my role prima facie being to understand the business requirements and suggest/implement effective actionable on the same. experience.description_html:
1. Program Manager: Insurance Go-Live
● Spearheaded the end-to-end go-to-market (GTM) strategy for a new insurance vertical, including
target segmentation, product positioning, and launch planning.
● Developed comprehensive program roadmaps with key milestones, deliverables, and cross-functional
execution timelines.
● Designed and implemented core operational processes (lead management, policy issuance, claims
handling) with integrated automation to enhance efficiency and system alignment.
2. Program Lead – Agent Engagement Pilot (PAN India)
● Designed and implemented a PAN India agent engagement framework, targeting priority segments
and high-potential regions.
● Led on-ground execution in Delhi and established monitoring mechanisms to track program
performance and engagement KPIs.
● Achieved 10% agent reactivation and 20% increase in business across 5 key states, driving measurable
growth for Manipal Fintech.
3. Lead – Bank Empanelment & Agreement Execution
● Acted as the primary liaison (SPOC) for Manipal Fintech partnerships with major banks, ensuring
end-to-end compliance and coordination.
● Successfully led the empanelment process with IDBI and Kotak Mahindra Bank, aligning with
regulatory and operational requirements.
● Supported agreement screening and negotiation with private banks in collaboration with C-suite
executives, ensuring favorable terms and risk mitigation.
4..Strategic Lead – New Business Ideation & Opportunity Mapping
● Created a structured ideation pipeline to systematically capture, assess, and prioritize new business
concepts.
● Conducted market potential analysis for identified ideas, evaluating feasibility, scalability, and alignment
with company objectives.
● Mapped opportunities for product portfolio expansion in unexplored segments, supporting long-term
growth strategy

1. Project Lead – New Business Vertical Launch (Cookware)
● Conducted market research across key target geographies and gathered competitive intelligence to
inform strategic positioning.

viability.

launch.

● Assisted Growth Heads in reactivating dormant business zones and driving channel partner
performance.

● Developed corporate decks and dashboards for Chairman, investors, and board members, enabling
data-driven decisions.

consumer electronics.
● Supported PMO cost-saving initiatives, conducted vendor scouting and comparative analysis, and
handled data for e-auctions.
● Facilitated cross-division collaboration for process optimization and operational efficiency.
